articles.headline: Biden Is Facing an Uneasy Truth: North Korea Isn’t Giving Up Its Nuclear Arsenal
articles.snippet: As President Biden prepares to meet South Korea’s president, he must grapple with the fact that the North’s stockpile of nuclear weapons and fuel has roughly doubled in the past four years.
articles.abstract: As President Biden prepares to meet South Korea’s president, he must grapple with the fact that the North’s stockpile of nuclear weapons and fuel has roughly doubled in the past four years.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Just weeks after President Biden took office, North Korea sent a subtle message to the new administration: It switched on key parts of its nuclear fuel production plant in Yongbyon, the aging complex where the country’s nuclear weapons program was born four decades ago.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger, William J. Broad and Choe Sang-Hun

articles.headline: Texas Pushes to Obscure the State’s History of Slavery and Racism
articles.snippet: Texas is awash in bills aimed at fending off critical examinations of the state’s past.
articles.abstract: Texas is awash in bills aimed at fending off critical examinations of the state’s past.
articles.lead_paragraph: Every morning, schoolchildren in Texas recite an oath to their state that includes the words, “I pledge allegiance to thee, Texas, one state under God.”

articles.headline: Israel and Hamas Agree to End a Brief War That Reverberated Worldwide
articles.snippet: The agreement is expected to conclude a battle in which Hamas fired rockets into Israel and Israel bombed targets in Gaza. More than 200 people were killed.
articles.abstract: The agreement is expected to conclude a battle in which Hamas fired rockets into Israel and Israel bombed targets in Gaza. More than 200 people were killed.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — After more than 10 days of fighting that has taken hundreds of lives and inspired protests and diplomatic efforts around the world, Israel and Hamas agreed to a cease-fire on Thursday, officials on both sides said.

articles.headline: Soaring Prices Herald Boom Time for Steel Makers
articles.snippet: A rebounding economy and Trump-era tariffs have helped drive the price of domestic steel to record highs.
articles.abstract: A rebounding economy and Trump-era tariffs have helped drive the price of domestic steel to record highs.
articles.lead_paragraph: For decades, the story of American steel had been one of job losses, mill closures and the bruising effects of foreign competition. But now, the industry is experiencing a comeback that few would have predicted even months ago.

articles.headline: New Owner Set for Chicago Tribune, Daily News and Baltimore Sun
articles.snippet: The bid by Alden Global Capital, which already owns about 200 local newspapers, had faced resistance from Tribune staff and last-ditch competition.
articles.abstract: The bid by Alden Global Capital, which already owns about 200 local newspapers, had faced resistance from Tribune staff and last-ditch competition.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tribune Publishing, the owner of some of the largest metropolitan newspapers in the United States, will be acquired by a hedge fund with a reputation for slashing costs and cutting newsroom jobs, after shareholders voted to approve the deal on Friday.
